description.narrative: Improved knowledge and capacity of public authorities, service providers and communities in identified disaster-prone and climate- risk areas to prepare for and respond to emergencies, reduce disaster risks, strengthen resilience and mitigate climate change impacts.

sector.narrative: CO/RO Supply - technical assistance and collaboration in supply chain, procurement of goods and services, and logistics
Capacity development of ECD frontline workers
Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
HSS - Risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Innovation, multi-media content production and dissemination
Maternal nutrition, including information, supplementation and counselling
Public health emergencies, including disease outbreaks
Research, monitoring and evaluation and knowledge management for C4D
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation in emergencies - improving sanitation services in communities
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social welfare workforce systems strengthening (accreditation, staffing and supervision)

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities emergency relief
Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

title.narrative: China United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved knowledge and capacity of public authorities, service providers and communities in identified disaster-prone and climate- risk areas to prepare for and respond to emergencies, reduce disaster risks, strengthen resilience and mitigate climate change impacts.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the Government of China in response to COVID-19 pandemic. In addition, the collaboration with the National Disaster Reduction Center of China (NDRCC) on Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) continued, focusing on procurement and distribution of emergency preparedness kits in project communities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/07/2020

title.narrative: Number of social service workers trained on specific knowledge and skills to deliver essential services during the COVID-19 pandemic with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID]

Core prevention and response interventions addressing violence against children through UNICEF-supported programmes (adapted to context of COVID-19): (a) number of mothers, fathers and caregivers reached through parenting programmes; and (b) number of girls and boys who have experienced violence reached by health, social work or justice/law enforcement services Number of children who have experienced violence reached by health, social work and/or law enforcement/justice (adapted for delivery dur
Child- and gender-sensitive standards and guidelines for emergency preparedness and DRR developed, tested and implemented in pilot areas

target.value: 2020:Sectoral and cross-sectoral standards and guidelines developed and piloted

actual.value: 2019:1; Draft Standards of National Comprehensive Disaster Reduction Demonstration County have been developed through a thematic study.
